publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4063♦ Mr Frank McAveety: Supporting the Living Wage for Scotland—That the Parliament welcomes the launch of the Scottish Living Wage Employer Awards being held in Dalmarnock; regrets the fact that there are around 700,000 workers in Scotland, the majority of them women, earning less than the Scottish living wage of £7.00 per hour; is aware that low pay can lock people into poverty and can be damaging for individuals, families, businesses, communities and the wider economy, and recognises the importance of encouraging employers in the public, private and voluntary sectors to ensure that all low-paid workers are paid no less than the Scottish living wage of £7.00 per hour.
S3M-4063♦ Supporting the Living Wage for Scotland (lodged on 5 May 2009) Hugh Henry*
